name: incipiency

the beginning of something: Not a single case treated by us from its incipiency developed any secondary symptoms. Given that financing is necessary at the incipiency of a film project, typically only an unfinished script exists at that point.
More examplesFewer examplesThese disease states all have their incipiency in negative physical and mental conditions.From the incipiency of health technology assessment in the 1970s, it has been argued that ethics should be central to the process.
